column4: hi and good morning do any of u know how can i display the file extensions in ubuntu ?
Most files don't have any. The system figures out what to use to run them by info in the first little bit of of the file
If whan you do: ls     and you don't see any file extension on the listing of a file's name, it doesn't have one
If you're curious what kind of file it is you can do: file filename
